translated: The Dhamma-reversal, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary

original: 11.3. Kusalattika, Upādinnattika🔽Nakusalaṁ naupādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā ekūnatiṁsa, ārammaṇe catuvīsa …pe… vipāke nava …pe… avigate ekūnatiṁsa.
analyzed: kusala attika upādinna ttika  na kusalam na aupādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca  hetuyā ekūnatisa ārammaṇe catuvīsa pe vipāke nava pe avigate ekūnatisa
translated: The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on the Subject

original: Nakusalaṁ naanupādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā sattarasa …pe… āsevane nava …pe… vipāke nava …pe… avigate sattarasa.
analyzed: na kusalam na anupādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca  hetuyā sattarasa pe āsevane nava pe vipāke nava pe avigate sattarasa
translated: With respect to the unwholesome, the subject of clinging, the object of clinging, the condition is by way of root, twenty-nine times; by way of object, twenty-four times; … by way of prenascence, twenty-four times; … by way of proximity, twenty-four times; … by way of contiguity, twenty-four times; … by way of immediate succession, twenty-four times; … by way of support, twenty-four times; … by way of decisive support, twenty-four times; … by way of pre-arising, twenty-four times; … by way of non-arising, twenty-four times; … by way of arising, twenty-four times; … by way of result, nine times; … by way of nutriment, four times; … by way of faculty, twelve times; … by way of path, twelve times; … by way of association, twenty-four times; … by way of dissociation, twenty-four times; … by way of presence, twenty-four times; … by way of absence, twenty-four times; … by way of disappearance, twenty-four times; … by way of non-disappearance, twenty-four times; … by way of cleansing, twenty-four times.

analyzed: na kusalam na anupādinna anupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca
translated: With respect to the unwholesome, the subject of clinging, the object of clinging, the condition is by way of root, seven times; … by way of nutriment, four times; … by way of faculty, three times; … by way of path, three times; … by way of association, seven times; … by way of dissociation, seven times; … by way of presence, seven times; … by way of absence, seven times; … by way of disappearance, seven times; … by way of non-disappearance, seven times; … by way of cleansing, seven times.

original: Hetuyā ekūnatiṁsa, ārammaṇe catuvīsa …pe… vipāke nava …pe… avigate ekūnatiṁsa.
analyzed: hetuyā ekūnatisa ārammaṇe catuvīsa pe vipāke nava pe avigate ekūnatisa
translated: With respect to the unwholesome, the subject of clinging, the object of clinging, the condition is by way of root, twenty-nine times; by way of object, twenty-four times; … by way of result, nine times; … by way of cleansing, twenty-four times.
